definitions.definition: good at learning, understanding and thinking in a logical way about things; showing this ability

examples.text: He should be able to solve the problem. He's reasonably intelligent.
Why do otherwise intelligent people take this event so seriously?
She asked a lot of intelligent questions.

definitions.definition: able to understand and learn things

examples.text: Elephants are intelligent creatures and enjoy interacting with humans.
a search for intelligent life on other planets

definitions.definition: able to store information and use it in new situations

wordOrigin: early 16th cent.: from Latin intelligent- ‘understanding’, from the verb intelligere, variant of intellegere ‘understand’, from inter ‘between’ + legere ‘choose’.
